ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Learned more about indonesian culture and how to properly speak it
Learned a lot more about Indonesian culture as well as getting better at the language.
I learned a lot about the connections between the Indonesian language and culture, along with the ways in which language shapes the culture.
learned how to further my indonesian language skills and learn more about Indonesian culture and societal concepts

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was a great course I would improve nothing. Bu is the best.

Weakness: There needs to be more feedback given on homework assignments.
Strengths: Lots of feedback for speaking assessments, highly engaging (Bu Dinny is the best), and eye-opening in terms of the content, which connected religion, society, culture, etc. to the language(s)/people in Indonesia.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The class was very well designed to deliver its mission during the Covid-19 era. Professor Aletheiani helped students who had problems related to the current times (technical issues and such).

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Anyone interested in learning more about Indonesia and the language itself should take this class.
Yes, it is a really great experience and opportunity to learn another language and culture.
Anyone interested in the Indonesian language and culture, or in the Southeast Asian culture, should take this course.
I would wholeheartedly recommend this course to another student
Yes, absolutely! Take it, without L4 it would have been very hard for me to begin to understand Indonesia's cultural, societal, religious, and ethnic landscape.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
